sentence.Network_en: He looked vaguely around the room as he spoke, his mind elsewhere.
sentence.Network_cn: 他边说话边茫然地打量着房间，心不在焉的样子。

sentence.Network_en: I vaguely remember snarling at someone who stepped on my foot.
sentence.Network_cn: 我隐约记得我曾向着那个踩了我一脚的人怒吼。

sentence.Network_en: Judith could vaguely remember her mother lying on the sofa.
sentence.Network_cn: 朱迪丝隐约记得她母亲躺在沙发上的情景。

大学英语精读单词表(第二册) - 豆丁网 ... wallet n. 皮夹 vaguely ad. 模糊地 vague a. 含糊的，不清的.
糖馨屋节目英语美句天天学第二十六期_沪江网 ... 1.precious 珍贵的 2.vaguely 暧昧地，茫然地 1.breath 呼吸.

list.abs: 外国电影【2178】(不含中国电影) ... 导演的坚持 Keep Up Your Right 新浪潮 NOUVELLE VAGUE 悲哀与我 Oh Woe Is Me.
KKBOX - elsa K.的个人首页 ... Nouvelle Vague( 同名专辑) Nouvelle Vague( 新浪潮乐团) High Violet( 紫罗兰).
“新浪潮电影”（nouvelle vague）一词，来自1957年法国记者法兰西吉哈德所提出的一句简洁的媒体影评策略性用语，以预示一个新影 …
vague limit 不梅极限vague topology 不梅的拓扑vaguely bounded operator 不梅有界算子
vacuous subset 空子集vague compactness 不梅紧性vague convergence 不梅收敛

entry.def: Vaguely means to some degree but not to a very large degree.

example.ex: The voice on the line was vaguely familiar, but Crook couldn't place it at first...
example.tran: 电话里的声音有点儿熟悉，但是克鲁克一开始想不起来到底是谁。
阿诺德感到有点儿尴尬。

auth_sentence.content: I was thirty-three, and Ray was vaguely thirty-nine.
auth_sentence.res_content: I was thirty-three, and Ray was vaguely thirty-nine.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: I was thirty-three, and Ray was vaguely thirty-nine.

auth_sentence.content: I was vaguely ill, still a little drunk.
auth_sentence.res_content: I was vaguely ill, still a little drunk.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: I was vaguely ill, still a little drunk.

auth_sentence.content: She likes to get into these vaguely erotic fights.
auth_sentence.res_content: She likes to get into these vaguely erotic fights.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: She likes to get into these vaguely erotic fights.

sentences.en: He gestured vaguely towards the house.
sentences.cn: 他含混地指了指那房子。

sentences.en: He had talked vaguely of going to work abroad.
sentences.cn: 他含糊其词地说了到国外工作的事。

sentences.en: He vaguely registered that the women had gone.
sentences.cn: 他依稀记得那几名妇人已经走了。

sentences.en: There was a sweetish smell, vaguely reminiscent of coffee.
sentences.cn: 有一股甜丝丝的气味, 使人隐隐觉得像是咖啡。

sentences.en: She looked vaguely around her and said:“I think I’m lost.”
sentences.cn: 她茫然地环顾四周,说道:“我想我迷路了。”

sentences.en: She felt vaguely flattered at the suggestion.
sentences.cn: 她对这样的提议感觉有点受宠若惊。

sentences.en: The name sounded vaguely familiar to her.
sentences.cn: 这个名字她听上去有点熟悉。
